title: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site: Plan A Field Trip
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Plan A Field Trip               Plan A Field Trip        The fort council room was the place where the Cheyenne Indians brought their buffalo robes for trade.  The trader uses Cheyenne sign language with visiting students.  NPS Photo       Guided Tour Reservation Information The park is open 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM with 10:30 AM and 1:00 PM guided tour times September through May and 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM with 9:30 AM, 11:00 AM, 1:00 PM and 2:30 PM tour times June through August. A short demonstration is included with the tour. Western National Parks Associaton's Bookstore offers videos, maps, and books for sale about the fort and the Santa Fe Trail. Plan on your visit lasting at least 2 hours. Call (719) 383-5026 for reservations.  In recognition of The Centennial Anniversary of the National Park Service, Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site will not collect Living History fees during the 2016 Calendar year, but donations to support the Living History Program will be greatly appreciated.  As a result of being a "Fee Free " park in 2016, Bent's Old Fort NHS will not have any of the Interagency Passes available to the public for the duration of the No Fee Period.  These passes may be obtained at other fee collecting parks, the Comanche National Grasslands Office in La Junta or at various offices of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, U.S. Forest Service, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, U.S. Forest Service, U.S. Bureau of Reclamation, U.S. Bureau of Land Management or the U.S. National Park Service.
